titleInfo.title: USA v. Martin
titleInfo.subTitle: JUDGMENT as to Eugene Martin (1), Count 1 - Defendant pleaded guilty to count I of the Indictment and is committed to custody of Bureau of Prisons for 70 months and shall self surrender for service as notified by the United States Marshal; 3 years supervised release with special conditions; $100.00 special assessment; Count 2 - Count II of the Indictment is dismissed on the motion of the USA as to this defendant onlyas to defendant Eugene Martin. Signed by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon on 8/22/2005. (4 certified copies given to U.S. Marshal) (ADB, )

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: JUDGMENT as to Eugene Martin (1), Count 1 - Defendant pleaded guilty to count I of the Indictment and is committed to custody of Bureau of Prisons for 70 months and shall self surrender for service as notified by the United States Marshal; 3 years supervised release with special conditions; $100.00 special assessment; Count 2 - Count II of the Indictment is dismissed on the motion of the USA as to this defendant onlyas to defendant Eugene Martin. Signed by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon on 8/22/2005. (4 certified copies given to U.S. Marshal) (ADB, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Martin
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER regarding 27 Motion for Hearing -Counsel for the government shall notify the court when the motion pursuant to Rule 35(b) is ripe for decision. The motion shall not be decided until counsel for the government certifies that the motion is ripe. Counsel for the defendant, if previously appointed pursuant to the Criminal Justice Act, is reappointed to represent the defendant for purposes of the Rule 35(b) motion. If retained, counsel for the defendant remains as counsel for the defendant untilthe Rule 35(b) motion is resolved or until given leave to withdraw.The Federal Public Defender shall provide CJA counsel with a new voucher as to Eugene Martin (1) Signed by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon on 7/5/2006. (TJS)

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: ORDER regarding 27 Motion for Hearing -Counsel for the government shall notify the court when the motion pursuant to Rule 35(b) is ripe for decision. The motion shall not be decided until counsel for the government certifies that the motion is ripe. Counsel for the defendant, if previously appointed pursuant to the Criminal Justice Act, is reappointed to represent the defendant for purposes of the Rule 35(b) motion. If retained, counsel for the defendant remains as counsel for the defendant untilthe Rule 35(b) motion is resolved or until given leave to withdraw.The Federal Public Defender shall provide CJA counsel with a new voucher as to Eugene Martin (1) Signed by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon on 7/5/2006. (TJS)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Martin
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER - A Rule 35 hearing regarding the Motion for Hearing 27 is scheduled before the undersigned on November 9, 2006, at 10:30a.m. in Courtroom No. 3(Omaha). At the request of the defendant through his counsel, and with the agreement of the government, the defendant may be absent from the hearing on the Rule 35 motion. The Marshal is directed to return the defendant to the district for this hearing as to defendant Eugene Martin. Ordered by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. - (Copies as directed/2 cc to USM)(KBJ)

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: ORDER - A Rule 35 hearing regarding the Motion for Hearing 27 is scheduled before the undersigned on November 9, 2006, at 10:30a.m. in Courtroom No. 3(Omaha). At the request of the defendant through his counsel, and with the agreement of the government, the defendant may be absent from the hearing on the Rule 35 motion. The Marshal is directed to return the defendant to the district for this hearing as to defendant Eugene Martin. Ordered by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. - (Copies as directed/2 cc to USM)(KBJ)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Martin
titleInfo.subTitle: AMENDED JUDGMENT (Reduction of Sentence) as to Eugene Martin. Defendant pleaded guilty to count I of the Indictment and is committed to custody of Bureau of Prisons for 48 months and is remanded to the USM; 3 years supervised release with special conditions; $100.00 special assessment (paid in full). Count II of the Indictment is dismissed on the motion of the USA as to this defendant only as to defendant Eugene Martin. Ordered by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. - (4 cc to USM)(KBJ)

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska

titleInfo.title: USA v. Martin
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER as to defendant Eugene Martin. Defendant is hereby transferred to Bristol Station. Douglas County jail shall immediately release the defendant to Bristol Station. Ordered by Chief Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. (1 Certified copy to USM)(AOA)

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: ORDER as to defendant Eugene Martin. Defendant is hereby transferred to Bristol Station. Douglas County jail shall immediately release the defendant to Bristol Station. Ordered by Chief Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. (1 Certified copy to USM)(AOA)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Martin
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER as to defendant Eugene Martin. The court's previous release order Filing No. 51) is vacated. The defendant is to be released from U.S. Marshal custody on January 25, 2011, at or about 9:00 a.m. The defendant is ordered to travel directly to Bristol Station, Hastings, Nebraska, to fulfill his commitment to community confinement consistent with this court's order modifying supervised release dated January 13, 2011, Filing No. 49. Ordered by Chief Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. (1 Certified copy to USM)(GJG)

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: ORDER as to defendant Eugene Martin. The court's previous release order Filing No. 51) is vacated. The defendant is to be released from U.S. Marshal custody on January 25, 2011, at or about 9:00 a.m. The defendant is ordered to travel directly to Bristol Station, Hastings, Nebraska, to fulfill his commitment to community confinement consistent with this court's order modifying supervised release dated January 13, 2011, Filing No. 49. Ordered by Chief Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. (1 Certified copy to USM)(GJG)
